Detailed Description

Interface to the main player object. There can only be one of these objects. Calling use("avg.js"); creates this object and names it AVGPlayer. AVGPlayer can be used to load, play and stop avg files, to access nodes, for timed function calls, and for several housekeeping tasks.

Member Function Documentation

boolean IAVGPlayer::clearInterval (  in long  id  ) 
 

Stops a timeout or an interval from being called. Returns true if there was an interval with the given id, false if not.

IAVGConradRelais IAVGPlayer::createRelais (  in short  port  ) 
 

Tries to initialize one or more conrad relais cards on /dev/ttyS?. port gives the serial port number the device is connected to.

IAVGEvent IAVGPlayer::getCurEvent (   ) 
 

Gets an interface to the current event. Only valid inside event handlers (onmouseup, onmousedown, etc.)

IAVGNode IAVGPlayer::getElementByID (  in string  id  ) 
 

Returns an element in the avg tree. The id corresponds to the id attribute of the node.

IAVGNode IAVGPlayer::getRootNode (   ) 
 

Returns the outermost element in the avg tree.

boolean IAVGPlayer::loadFile (  in string  fileName  ) 
 

Loads the avg file specified in fileName. Returns false if the file could not be opened.

void IAVGPlayer::play (  in float  framerate  ) 
 

Opens a playback window or screen and starts playback. framerate is the number of frames per second that should be displayed.

void IAVGPlayer::setDebugOutput (  in long  flags  ) 
 

Sets the amount and type of debug data that should be displayed on the console. flags are one or more of the DEBUG_XXX-constants, ored together.

void IAVGPlayer::setDebugOutputFile (  in string  name  ) 
 

Specifies that debug output should go to a file and not to the console.

long IAVGPlayer::setInterval (  in long  time,
in string  code
) 
 

Sets javascript code that should be executed every time milliseconds. The smallest timeframe that can be set is once per frame. If less than that is specified, the code will be executed exactly once per frame. The function returns an id that can be used to call clearInterval() to stop the code from being called.

long IAVGPlayer::setTimeout (  in long  time,
in string  code
) 
 

Sets javascript code that should be executed after time milliseconds. The function returns an id that can be used to call clearInterval() to stop the code from being called.

void IAVGPlayer::stop (   ) 
 

Stops playback and resets the video mode if nessesary.

Member Data Documentation

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_BLTS = 1
 

Outputs data about the display subsystem. Useful for timing/performance measurements.

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_ERROR = 32
 

Outputs error messages. Can't be shut off.

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_EVENTS = 8
 

Outputs basic event data.

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_EVENTS2 = 16
 

Outputs all event data available.

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_MEMORY = 4
 

Outputs memory usage information.

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_NONE = 0
 

Turns off debug output.

const long IAVGPlayer::DEBUG_PROFILE = 2
 

Outputs performance statistics and frames displayed too late.
